results.title: Defense Lawyers Point Out ‘Holes’ in Case Against Dean Skelos and Son
results.abstract: Lawyers for the state senator and his son, Adam B. Skelos, hammered away at what they said was the government’s mischaracterization of recorded conversations, emails and testimony.
results.byline: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and SUSANNE CRAIG

results.title: Dean Skelos’s Son Kept a Hand Out, and Never Took ‘No’ for an Answer
results.abstract: Witnesses at the corruption trial of Mr. Skelos, a New York State senator, and his son Adam have said that the father spared no effort asking for favors for his son.

multimedia.caption: State Senator Dean G. Skelos leaving Federal District Court in Manhattan on Tuesday after closing arguments in the corruption trial in which he and his son Adam are co-defendants.

results.title: Mosque Shows That Muslims Have Long Been a Part of New York
results.abstract: Evidence is coming to light that Muslims not only lived in a downtown community near the turn of the 20th century, but worshiped there, too.

multimedia.caption: One of New York's first mosques operated out of 17 Rector Street, seen in 1930, once in the heart of the Little Syria neighborhood downtown.
One of New York's first mosques operated out of 17 Rector Street, seen in 1930, once in the heart of the Little Syria neighborhood downtown.

results.title: Jimmy McMillan, Rent Is Too Damn High Candidate, Is Retiring From Politics
results.abstract: Mr. McMillan, who ran for governor of New York in 2010 and has also run for mayor, cited a lack of public support and said voters had been “totally brainwashed.”
org_facet: Rent Is Too Damn High Party

multimedia.caption: Jimmy McMillan, center, at a debate during the 2010 governor's race with Carl P. Paladino, left, the Republican candidate, and Andrew M. Cuomo, Democrat.

results.title: James Burke, Ex-Police Chief for Suffolk County, Is Arrested
results.abstract: A federal indictment says Mr. Burke, who resigned two months ago, faces charges of civil rights violations and obstructing a civil rights investigation.
results.byline: By SARAH MASLIN NIR and ARIELLE DOLLINGER

multimedia.caption: James Burke, center, was arrested Wednesday morning on charges of civil rights violations and obstructing a civil rights investigation.
James Burke, center, was arrested Wednesday morning on charges of civil rights violations and obstructing a civil rights investigation.

results.title: 2 in New York Police Dept. Are Accused of Taking Bribes From Bar Owners
results.abstract: A New York City police lieutenant and a detective took bribes from the owners of karaoke bars in Queens and gave warnings of police raids, according to criminal complaints.

results.title: Mayor de Blasio Draws Criticism for Plan to Pay for Security in Private Schools
results.abstract: The New York City Council has passed a bill that will reimburse private and parochial schools for the cost of hiring unarmed guards, at a cost of nearly $20 million.

results.title: Judge Acquits Guard in Assault That Maimed New York State Prisoner
results.abstract: Michael Bukowski, an officer at the Ulster Correctional Facility, had been suspended after the July 2014 attack on Ramon Fabian, an inmate.
results.byline: By MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ and MICHAEL WINERIP

results.title: Remembering Lennon, Amid a Debate About Gun Violence
results.abstract: The commemoration of the musician’s death online was absorbed into one of the political fights of the moment.

multimedia.caption: People gathered at Strawberry Fields in Central Park on Tuesday to commemorate the 35th Anniversary since the death of John Lennon.

results.title: New York Court Dismisses Challenge to Nail Salon Wage Protections
results.abstract: Salon owners objected to a new rule requiring them to buy insurance bonds meant to protect low-paid workers from wage theft.

results.title: New York Police Officer Fatally Shoots Unarmed Man After Chase Into Westchester
results.abstract: The chase, which ended in Miguel Espinal’s death, led to the shutdown of the Saw Mill River Parkway in Yonkers, just north of the Bronx border.
results.byline: By AL BAKER and J. DAVID GOODMAN

multimedia.caption: The police chase began shortly before noon, when two officers from the 50th Precinct in the Bronx, on patrol in a marked car, saw a gray 2009 Nissan Z driving erratically and followed it.

results.title: Working Families Party Endorses Bernie Sanders for President
results.abstract: The decision to support Senator Sanders has divided the labor-aligned party’s leaders, some of whom have endorsed Hillary Clinton for the Democratic nomination.
results.byline: By ALEXANDER BURNS and MAGGIE HABERMAN

multimedia.caption: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont. The leadership of the Working Families Party pledged on Tuesday to help him win Democratic primaries in the 2016 presidential campaign.

results.title: New York Looks Into ‘Speculative’ Ticket Resellers
results.abstract: The attorney general sent letters to StubHub and other resale sites regarding high-priced listings of concert tickets even before they go on sale.

results.title: A Pink Bikini in November
results.abstract: A man who had thought he had seen everything was astounded at the sight of a woman in a pink bikini riding a scooter on Lexington Avenue.

results.title: I Love You (Can I Crash?)
results.abstract: A romance with a singer that began on Twitter progresses to sex and a request to stay the night.

results.title: A Dog’s West Side Prey
results.abstract: A family pet in Central Park dashed off and returned with a locally appropriate baked product.

results.title: After Losing His Mom, He Finds the Will to Move On
results.abstract: After his mother died, Lamont Foxhall, who lives with depression and arthritis, recalls his mother’s voice on a recording for strength when he needs it most.
org_facet: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
